basics.name: Paolo Gajo
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: PhD student in NLP at the University of Bologna. Researching graph neural networks and large language models for semantic dependency parsing, information extraction, and understanding of graph-structured texts. Thesis focuses on automatic culinary recipe adaptation based on dietary constraints.

publications.name: Dependency Parsing is More Parameter-Efficient with Normalization
publications.summary: Reduces parameter usage by 85% in SOTA dependency parsers through normalization techniques.

publications.name: Natural vs Programming Language in LLM Knowledge Graph Construction
publications.summary: Analyzes LLM performance on knowledge graph construction tasks involving both natural and programming languages.

publications.name: LEARN: on the feasibility of Learner Error AutoRegressive Neural annotation
publications.summary: Proposes an LLM approach to learner error annotation.

publications.name: On Cross-Language Entity Label Projection and Recognition
publications.summary: Investigates multilingual label projection for entity recognition.

publications.name: UniBO at CheckThat! 2024: Multi-lingual and Multi-label Persuasion Technique Detection in News
publications.summary: Describes multilingual models for persuasion detection in news articles.

publications.name: On the Identification and Forecasting of Hate Speech in Inceldom
publications.summary: Studies hate speech evolution in online incel communities.

publications.name: Hate Speech Detection in an Italian Incel Forum Using Bilingual Data for Pre-Training and Fine-Tuning
publications.summary: Applies bilingual pre-training to hate speech detection.

publications.name: Hate Speech According to the Law: An Analysis for Effective Detection
publications.summary: Examines the legal dimension of hate speech detection.

education.area: Graph Neural Networks and Text-to-Graph Models
